thread.title: 7 things to know now: Lamar Odom found unresponsive in brothell
thread.title_full: 7 things to know now: Lamar Odom found unresponsive in brothell | www.ajc.com

author: Debbie Lord
title: 7 things to know now: Lamar Odom found unresponsive in brothell
text:
1. Larmar Odom found unresponsive : Former NBA player and reality star Lamar Odom was found unresponsive in a Las Vegas brothel Tuesday. The ex-husband of Khloe Kardashian had been taking Viagra and had consumed part of a bottle of cognac, according to the owner of the Love Ranch brothel near Las Vegas. Odom, who is 6-foot-10, was too tall to be airlifted to the hospital and had to be taken by ambulance.
Respect to Kobe Bryant who reportedly left the game last night to be by Lamar Odom's side. #brothers #lamarodom pic.twitter.com/1Lpqqg25lP
— Ball Don't Stop (@balldontstop) October 14, 2015 2. How to get some legislative attention : Seems that if you want to get the ear of your representatives in Washington all you have to do is tweet on Twitter, or post on Facebook. According to a survey of congressional aides, it takes fewer than 10 social media posts or tweets in response to what a representative of senator said or did on an issue to get the attention of that person’s staff. Want the most attention? Respond the quickest.
>> Read more trending stories
3. Clinton scores in debate : Hillary Clinton is being seen by most as the winner of the first Democratic debate of the 2016 election season. The former secretary of state got applause when she said a House select committee investigating the attack on the American Consulate in Benghazi, Libya, “is basically an arm of the Republican National Committee.” Here opponent, Sen. Barry Sanders, scored points when he said about Clinton, “the American people are sick and tired of hearing about your damn emails.”
Fact checks of the candidates during last night's #DemDebate : http://t.co/hpmfGSg87s pic.twitter.com/FJCC9V55nt
— The New York Times (@nytimes) October 14, 2015 4. Not in favor of tribute : The Southern Christian Leadership Conference and the Atlanta and DeKalb branches of the NAACP say they are not in favor of a tribute to Rev. Martin Luther King Jr. that is planned for Stone Mountain. The groups are opposed to the placement of a tribute there because, by Georgia law, the site is designated a Confederate memorial. Representatives of the group are set to meet with Gov. Nathan Deal Wednesday.
5. Toddler found dead : A 3-year-old New Jersey boy was found dead just hours after he was reported missing Tuesday. Brendan Creato was found dead in woods about a half a mile from his Haddon Township home. He had been reported missing around 6 a.m. Authorities say they are waiting on autopsy results to determine the cause of death.
>> Read more trending stories
And one more
A study released Tuesday offers some good news for those who enjoy a glass of wine -- or two. Seems “moderate” amounts of wine are even more beneficial than first thought – helping to lower cholesterol levels and lowering the incidence of type-2 diabetes. According to a study published in the Annals of Internal Medicine , a nightly glass of wine with dinner may be what the doctor ordered for many people.
In case you missed it
The parents of two young men killed in a car accident in England have released a video taken by the boys moments before the crash. They say they hope it makes young people think before acting irresponsibly behind the wheel of a car.
